FuncDef:
The transmission-alarm down command customizes alarms for 10GE WAN or POS interfaces globally, that is, specifies alarms that can cause a physical interface to go Down.
The undo transmission-alarm down command cancels the alarms customized for 10GE WAN or POS interfaces globally.
By default, only LRDI, PAIS, PRDI, LAIS, LOF, and LOS alarms are enabled globally on 10GE WAN or POS interfaces, which can cause the physical interface to go Down.
CLIs: transmission-alarm down pos { los | lof | lais | oof | lrdi | lcd | auais | b3tca | lom | lop | lrei | pais | prdi | prei | pplm | puneq | rdool | rrool | sdbere | sfbere | trool | b1tca | b2tca } *
transmission-alarm down wan { los | lof | lais | oof | lrdi | lcd | auais | b3tca | lom | lop | lrei | pais | prdi | prei | pplm | puneq | rdool | rrool | sdbere | sfbere | trool | b1tca | b2tca } *

undo transmission-alarm down wan [ los | lof | lais | oof | lrdi | lcd | auais | b3tca | lom | lop | lrei | pais | prdi | prei | pplm | puneq | rdool | rrool | sdbere | sfbere | trool | b1tca | b2tca ] *

undo transmission-alarm down pos [ los | lof | lais | oof | lrdi | lcd | auais | b3tca | lom | lop | lrei | pais | prdi | prei | pplm | puneq | rdool | rrool | sdbere | sfbere | trool | b1tca | b2tca ] *

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The frequent generation of alarms causes the physical status of an interface to continuously alternate between Up and Down and continuous network flapping. To customize alarms for 10GE WAN or POS interfaces globally, run the transmission-alarm down command. This configuration specifies alarms that can cause a physical interface to go Down.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
By default, the LAIS, LOF, and LOS alarms can change the interface status. If these types of alarms are disabled, service data cannot be forwarded correctly.After the transmission-alarm down command is run, a global 10GE WAN or POS interface becomes Down only when the specified alarm is generated, and the previous configuration performed using this command is deleted.After the undo transmission-alarm down command is run, a global 10GE WAN or POS interface does not become Down when the specified alarm is generated.If the global alarm customization function is configured and the non-default alarm customization configuration exists on an interface, the configuration on the interface takes effect. If the configuration on the interface is the default alarm customization configuration, the global configuration takes effect.WLNK alarms can be viewed only and cannot be configured by using this command. The WLNK alarms are always enabled and can cause the physical status of interfaces to go Down. You can run the display transmission-alarm command to view the status and statistics on the alarms.
